captions.text: - (laughs) This is so...
- (sigh) Um.
(laughs)

- I mean I just haven't
mastered having a period yet

(laughs) I'm like, something--
it's a period horror story
every time I'm on my period.
(laughs)
- The first time I was hooking up
with this guy, everything was great
and I spent the night, and then
the next morning I realized I had gotten
my period and it completely surprised me.
There was a mess and I just hid in the
bathroom for a half-hour after I woke up
because I didn't know how to face him
or how to talk about it.

When I did finally come
out of the bathroom,

he was totally cool
with it, he didn't care,
it was fine, we went out for breakfast,
and then three years later I married him.
So it all worked out.
- Most recently, I went to Virginia
to meet my boyfriend's parents

and I fell asleep on the train
'cause it's the middle of
the night and then I woke up, and sat up,
something went wrong (laughs).
Then I have to make some crazy excuse
for like, putting something on my seat,
and then going into my bag and having to
put on different jeans.
- This happened like three weeks ago,

so you think I would have
had stuff together by now,

and been just better at this
entire thing, but I'm not.
- I was changing my tampon and about
to put a new one in, then I saw a string
already hanging out.
- And I pulled out one tampon,
and I pulled out a second one.

- And I was like, oh my
gosh, there's already

a tampon in there so I
had been wearing two.
- Two, like there were two inside of me?
- For I don't know how long.
- What the (bleep).

- So I was at work and you
know how when you're at work
you like hide your tampon in your sleeve.

I wasn't wearing sleeves
that day, it was a hot day,
and I put the tampon in my bra, as you do.
And started walking down the hallway

and kind of got distracted
talking to people.

I was just like making
my way down the hall.

And I get to the bathroom
and I realize that

my tampon had been sticking
out of my bra the entire time.
- Okay, so in high school in math class
I just like, bled through everything.

And I could tell, and I
was like really scared

because it was like past
the point of getting up

and going to the bathroom
and doing something about it.
I just didn't do anything about it,
I just left the scene of the crime.

- I tried to use a
tampon for the first time

and I went swimming and
hung out at the beach

all day with the plastic
applicator still on,
and like still inside, and I was
just like this is really painful!
- I dunno why (laughs) I'm just,
like, that happens to me all the time.

title: Women Share Their Period Horror Stories

comments.text:
My story is to try and figure out when my period comes. I know what "time" 
of the month but it is never on the same day which i hate.﻿
comments.author: Selena Young

comments.text: My period horror story: sneezing.﻿
comments.author: LauraIsGeeky

comments.text:
Who is the first girl??? In purple laughing saying "This is so 
embarrassing"?????﻿
comments.author: Ed Ed

comments.text: I once got my period while having sex with a guy. It was so embarrassing..﻿
comments.author: Kate Hettinger

comments.text:
I was in taekwondo, and my instructor says "your leg is bleeding" im like 
omg :(﻿
comments.author: Jesus Aka

comments.text: The first story is so cute. ﻿
comments.author: Leah Cooke

comments.text:
One time I was out with My bf and I had My period. I started feeling dizzy 
and nauseous so we went outside. Then I randomly started crying for no 
reason. I started feeling so much pain like I was going to pass out. My bf 
rushed Me home and I thought I was going to die. I had to stay completely 
still because I was so dizzy and I ended up having to vomit into a plastic 
bag. The end.﻿
comments.author: OnniArt

comments.text: what is a period﻿
comments.author: gaming of the north

comments.text:
Once I was at high school and I was on the library during the lunch time. 
We couldn't go upstairs (where the bathroom is), but I noticed that I was 
starting to bleed and I told my bff that I had to go to the bathroom, so we 
decided to go upstairs. We were nearly there when a teacher saw us and 
started shouting at us, and my friend wanted to go down and explain but I 
was like, no, there's no time (Ibleeeded a lot that times) so we went 
running to the bathroom and I saw that my leggings had blod and I didnt 
have anything to cover it...and I still had 2 h to go!!! It was horrible...﻿
comments.author: Marina Plana

comments.text:
I've had the two tampon thing happen to me once xp fucking terrible 
feeling. I was like no wonder it hurt so bad. 

When I'm on my period I get really weak and start to vomit and have loose 
stools. It's literally the worst thing ever. One time in my medical class, 
I like passed out on the desk and it looked like I was asleep. Then I woke 
up and asked the teacher, "Can I go throw up?" So I like threw up in a 
trash can in front of the whole class and was escorted in a wheelchair by 
several nurses. It was crazy. I had a smile on my face once I was on the 
wheelchair though.﻿
comments.author: Samantha Garcia

comments.text:
Mine is so similar to the girl in the glasses, it was horrendous!
I was in a science lesson and my period must have started without me 
realising. I was the last one out of the class but as I stood up the WHOLE 
wooden seat on the stool I had sat on was covered in blood. The male 
teacher was still in there so I just made a quick escape. 
The worst part was that a couple of days later in the same class the chair 
hadn't been cleaned but has moved places and everyone was saying they 
didn't want the chair with 'red', now slightly brown, 'paint' on it... How 
embarrassing.﻿
comments.author: Becky Cox

comments.text:
I've never had a problem with periods.. I think the worst thing I had 
happen was just getting my white underwear dirty..﻿
comments.author: QueenEtna

comments.text:
I'm not embarrassed of my period. Heck, once I asked a guy (yes, a GUY) if 
I was stained and he said no, all cool with it. :P﻿
comments.author: Rainbow Dash

comments.text:
I got my first period exactly on my 12th birthday. So like any normal girl 
I was afraid to tell my mom. Bad idea. I end up making a "ratchet pad" as 
my friend likes to call it out of toilet paper, and go to school with it 
on. Now, I play cello which means I have to open my legs, no idea but I was 
bleeding through my khakis the whole entire 5th period so when I wen't to 
P.E to change I found out and was like, "OH MY GOD!" went to my locker 
partner and asked her for a spare pad if she had one, she wasn't on it yet, 
ask another person for fifty cents so I can buy one they give it to me and 
I go to the machine and it's broken, wtf do I do. I ended up making another 
makeshift pad and wearing it because I really had no other choice, luckily 
our school P.E uniforms have red basketball shorts.

And now I'm a softmore in highschool and I still don't wear Tampons, anyone 
else care to share a story? XD﻿
comments.author: Muffin Mendes

comments.text:
The comments section of this video makes me sad because it looks like a ton 
of parenting/education fails. I'm not referring to some of the accidents 
either(they happen), but more regarding people who are disillusioned about 
female anatomy or who have been brought up to be ashamed of basic bodily 
functions. It's sad :(﻿
comments.author: GhOsT ID

comments.text:
My first period started when my grandma and my little sisters were at the 
car dealership. I was 12, and my little sisters were 6 and 8 respectively. 
I couldn't tell them about it because they would have no idea what it 
meant! My grandma was busy talking to some guy, and she wouldn't know how 
to help. We would be there for another 5 hours, so I had to stuff a bunch 
of toilet paper in my undies and hope no one noticed the fact I was walking 
as if I had a ball between my legs. 

Then, skip ahead a few months, I'm still in 6th grade and I look down at my 
shorts after feeling a bit wet in history. I saw a lot of blood. I went up 
to my teacher. Worst of all, he was a guy, so it was SUPER awkward to tell 
him that I needed to go to the nurse. He asked me why, and I just looked 
down. He looked down and saw me covered with blood and then nodded after 
instructing me to wrap my jacket around my waist. What a nice day.﻿
comments.author: Rachel Deal

comments.text: The ladt one shared.. i did that too... at lake compouncw﻿
comments.author: Brianna Boder

comments.text:
When I got my first period I wasn't scared I was kinda ticked off I was 
just grate now j have to deal with this every month lucky for me I only get 
the like every 2/3 months but when I do get them its the worst I get really 
bad cramps and it last for like 8 to 9 days ﻿
comments.author: Camille683

comments.text:
I have to admit, I have a respect for what all you amazing woman in this 
world have to go through every month... >.<

Boners can't even compare to the levels of inconvenience... ;-;﻿
comments.author: raganok1

comments.text:
The day before I first got my period I had accidentally ran straight into a 
soccer goal post, so when I got it I was really nauseous and stuff so my 
mum took me to hospital because she thought concussion had caused that, not 
my period. Had a really awkward talk with one of the nurses....﻿

I was at a like4 hour swim meet with a zebra swimsuit and I only had a 
light tampon and only one so like in the middle of it I got told by my 
friend I should close my legs blood all over the swimsuit bottom Idk how 
long it was there before she commented﻿
comments.author: Sarah Laduke

comments.text:
Well in 7th grade not long ago. I had my period and i have pads because the 
blood always slides down the damn pad and bleeds threw my cloths. One day i 
was in class and it bleed threw my pants onto my set and i had no damn idea 
until the girl who hates me screams "CAELYN BLEED THREW!" And everyone 
started laughing and calling me gross. I had no friends at school and 
everyone was my enemy so I couldn't tell anyone how embarrassed i felt. The 
teacher sent me to the bathroom to change pants and my dad had to bring me 
my new pants because my mom pasted away not long before then so my dad had 
to help shop for pads and tampons... He would not let me leave so i had to 
walk back in with everyone still laughing at me like idiots. Still no one 
likes me so im homeschooled now 😂 ﻿
comments.author: caelyn crochet

comments.text:
Here's mine. I went to change my tampon in day 2 and it was a super maxi 
heavy duty one and I was gonna take it out and at the lightest tug it 
projectile shot out of me into the toilet and blood saturated water 
splashed all over me, my clothes, the floor, the counter, the magazine 
rack, and the wall. It looked like the scene of a murder... ﻿
comments.author: iloveallpple

comments.text:
My very first period was on January 17, 2013  7th grade (yes I know I 
remembered it)
This was during lunch around 12:30 pm my stomach started hurting. Down 
there started hurting and I could hardly walk since I also needed to pee! 
So by the time I got to the restroom (good thing that I wore navy pants), I 
looked at my panties and saw blood. I was like; "Yep I knew it." I was 12 
years old at the time but I didn't freak out. I was upset though. I 
remember when I constantly kept checking my underwear when I used the 
bathroom because I was confuse if I was starting my first period or 
discharge.﻿
comments.author: Mung Bean

comments.text: Buzzfeed red ﻿
comments.author: Gillian Ferrara

comments.text:
The first time I got my period was at my sister's wedding.
When trying to tell my mom, she would say "Honey, lets talk later. Today is 
your sisters day"
So I had to tell my best friend (a 12 y/o boy), who told his mom.
Needless to say, it was one of the worst days of my life.﻿
comments.author: Amanda Harbach

comments.text:
I got my period when I was 12, so not only was being in middle school like 
the most awkward time of my life, but I also had to deal with periods! It 
was a dress up day for my basketball team and I wore khaki slacks. Long 
story short I had forgotten to change my tampon and bleed through! It was 
really noticable and my DUDE friend had to point it out to me. I was so 
embarrassed. All my guy friends made jokes about it for weeks.﻿
comments.author: hjw1495

comments.text:
My first period surprised me so much. We had a small swimming pool in our 
garden, I got out of it to eat some cookies, after that I went to the 
bathroom and noticed my bloody panties. I've had sex ed and all that so I 
knew about girls getting their periods but I didn't realize I had my first 
period and spent 15 mins in the bathroom like "oh my god why am I bleeding 
there, what's happening to me"
I went back into the swimming pool (I was alone in there) just so no one 
will notice and to get my panties and shorts clean lmao. Back home I 
finally calmed down, realized what's happening and told my Mom that I'm in 
desperate need of pads. That was the only weird experience I've had though 
lol﻿
comments.author: supadupasumi

comments.text:
I got my first period the evening before we went on a one week school trip

panties and the thermo leggings! Luckily I had thick salopettes on that 
didn't show it. But I felt so uncomfortable and embarrassed anyhow :/﻿

 She didn't even know it had happened, and everyone was laughing at her all

comments.text:
My wife had gone to Japan and I was taking care of my 10 year old daughter 
when in the morning......<girl scream> I am bleeding and she had started 
her 1st period. So I explain what it is and then go to get the old neighbor 
woman for what to use but.....she wasn't there......I don't know much about 
tampons or pads or what to get a girl starting a period.  Off to the store 
and the woman's stuff that  I have avoided my whole life.  So much stuff!! 
So I had to ask one of the female staff what to get.

Then at home my daughter had to figure out how to use one...Dad where does 
the sticky part go??  Read the box, read the box......call mom ask her. 
Costly call but worth it.

My daughter jokes about it to this day.....at which time I bring out the 
pictures of her riding the dog buck naked at 2 years old and threaten to 
show her friends﻿
comments.author: Xatasha6611

comments.text: These ladies are awesome :) So funny.﻿
comments.author: m.

comments.text:
there was this one time during school when it was really hot in my fourth 
hour and I was wearing skinny-ass jeans (a fantastic idea while I'm on my 
period) and my butt was kinda sweaty. After the bell rang, I was going to 
band and my butt still felt wet but I didn't worry about it because I 
assumed I was still sweaty. I went downstairs, through the band room, into 
the storage room, got out my instrument, sat down in my seat for the daily 
announcements. I thank the period gods that my pencil fell off my stand, 
because when I reached down to grab it, that's when I saw the brownish 
stain on my inner thighs.

This would be a horrible enough situation, but the guy who sits next to me 
just happens to be the same person that I had a major crush on. So I did 
the logical thing and slid sideways onto the floor and scooted on my ass to 
my backpack, praying that I didn't leave a trail. I stuffed a tampon into 
my pocket and tied my WINTER COAT around my waist and all but sprinted to 
bathroom. The first thing i try to do is scrub as much blood out of my 
undies as possible with a piece of dry, single-ply toilet paper. Then i 
wrapped three layers around the crotch to try to prevent it from further 
staining my jeans. After that I yanked out my tampon, and the thing wasn't 
even completely soaked through. So because I'm a reasonable human being, I 
politely expressed to the tampon what a fucking piece of shit it was, and 
where it should go stick itself. 

And that is the story of why I started using a menstrual cup.﻿

comments.text:
I sadly had to wear khakis all high school 
THAT DOES NOT GO WELL ﻿

﻿
comments.author: Diana D

comments.text:
I have a pretty heavy flow. I've lost count on how many times I've bled 
through. I bleed through to my panties every damn time I have my period. 
Once in school, I sat on a bench with a friend, and noticed I'd bled 
through. She was a girl, too, but I was 13 years old and periods were kind 
of taboo for me. So I started making weird movements to cover up, and then 
I'd take my hand to start wiping it off, while still trying to look casual. 
I must have looked really weird lol. I've also bled on chairs in class, but 
I, too, left the crime scene. Just look casual and put the chair under the 
table quick and hope nobody's looking. I still make the mistake sometimes 
not to wear black pants on the worst days. I don't know why I never 
learn...﻿

I was at the hospital bc I was getting my cast of my foot cause I Broke it

comments.author: Sophie Edwards

comments.text:
I had gotten my period on the morning I was meant to be going to my 
friends house in the hot tub with a bunch of girls. I was super annoyed 
because I had been looking forward to it. My friend was like aw it will be 
fine you can just borrow a tampon, but I had never tried a tampon because I 
was kinda scared. Anyway it was after school and I was at her house and I 
was like, it's okay guys I'll just sit at the side, and they were all like 
awh hell nawh just put a tampon in, so I tried it and I couldn't do, it 
hurt like hell and it just wouldn't go up, I started panicking that my 
vagina was broken or something. So anyway I tried again and it just wasn't 
working and they were all giving me support from outside the bathroom. I 
started to cry cause I thought that I probably didn't even have a vagina 
hole because it wouldn't go up and so we all watched some educational 
period videos and I like got through my friends entire tampon pack until we 
came to the conclusion that it wasn't going to work but they convinced me 
to go in the hotub anyway with like five pairs of pants on and I was all 
good. So that's my story, I have just officially embarrassed my self for 
life im going to change my name to Rodriguez and move to Mexico ﻿

comments.author: EveryTigerRocks

comments.text:
I have two
1. The first time I got my period ever, it was like 2 A.M. and I told my 
mom and she was like, "I don't have anything, so, just use toilet paper 
until the morning and I'll pick some up and drop them off before I go to 
work." And I was like, "okay," then when i woke up, I couldn't find the 
pads or anything, and it was just a horrible mess.
2. One time, I went to sleep at a sleepover, and, when I woke up, I had 
bled through my underwear, my pants, and almost through the sheets, and I 
just had to awkwardly cover it up and hope they didn't suspect me lol﻿
comments.author: EveryTigerRocks

comments.text:
We forgot to close the bathroom door when we went out one time when I was 
in high school, got home to shredded used pads all over the living room, 
courtesy of our dog Franklin. Not only was I like 17, but I was the only 
one in the house capable of menstruation. So everyone knew exactly what it 
was and whose blood they were looking at, and picking up slobber covered 
used pads is just not a fun experience.﻿

comments.text:
Does anyone else use pads and not tampons? I just don't want to stick

comments.text:
My period is super irregular. I've skipped a month at a time (I'm a virgin 
and am 100% positive I'm not pregnant) so every month I can't plan so it's

comments.author: Grace Wilson

comments.text:
I have 3 and they all involve bleeding through. I got my period when I was 
11 and it wasn't until freshman year of high school that I had my 1st 
incident. It was the class before lunch I was let out about 10 minutes 
early to use the restroom and when I stood up I felt a flood of warmth all 
over my special area and down my butt, I power walked to the bathroom with 
my sweater tied around me while I was still feeling it going down my thigh, 
I get to the restroom and my pad, underwear, and jeans are SOAKED like 
never before. That had to be the worst it, it was just so much blood in 
like a minute. Even the sweater didn't cover it, I had to ask a teacher to 
walk closely behind me to cover me. That teacher was an angel lol I still 
cried when i got to the office though lol
2nd time it was in college I was sitting weird and I laughed and I felt 
that flood again I knew what was comming so I stood up and to my horror 
realized there was actually blood on the fucking chair. Luckily it was 
plastic, I was sitting in the back corner, and I had those little alcohol 
wipes in my bag so I just wiped it quickly and snuck out of the class. That 
time my jeans were only soaked in that one spot where it leaked, not all 
over the butt and thigh area. 
The 3rd time happened when I was taking a nap on my boyfriend's bed. I bled 
through my pajamas, through his WHITE comforter and sheets, and onto the 
actual mattress itself. I cried that time too, we got the blood out of the 
comforter surprisingly easy but not the mattress :(﻿
comments.author: Icela Madrigal

comments.text:
I don't understand how they all happened neither because I've always had a 
heavy flow and I know this so I use the night time pads 24/7 and change 
them every chance I get. I think it's just cuz it's a giant sudden flow 
that even the best pad can't absorb it all. In all the cases the pad did do 
it's job though, it did absorb to its limit it was just the blood was more 
than the pad could physically absorb lol
comments.author: Icela Madrigal

comments.text: That first story was heart touching ﻿
comments.author: Kerrin C

comments.text:
Hmm... period horror stories. Is that like horror stories from the 15th to 
19th century? :)﻿
comments.author: Alien Weirdo

comments.text: I'm sorry but I legit thought the girl at 2:20 was a dude﻿
comments.author: TecBlue

comments.text: The first girls story is so cute awh ﻿
comments.author: lisellefie

comments.text:
Has anyone truly mastered having a period yet? Because I'm 20 and even 
after years of multiple periods, I still haven't gotten my shit together. I 
always manage to bleed through everything >:(﻿
comments.author: Marissa Sanchez

comments.text:
I was at school and I didn't know my period had started WAY earlier. Later 
it bled through. Since I thought I just had to pee I went to the bathroom. 
When I came back (I realized it bled) I had to go to the teacher than into 
the gym To my gym locker (where there were lots of people) and change. When 
I came back I found out everyone saw and didn't tell me... My favorite 
pants are ruined.... Luckily only girls laughed (which was surprising). The 
guys acted like it was usual. It was REALLY embarrassing.﻿
comments.author: Kristen Owens

comments.text:
And then I realized it got onto the seat and they took it out of the room. 
And then EVERYONE knew
comments.author: Kristen Owens

comments.text:
The first time I had my period I was twelve years old.  I woke up, got out 
of bed and just felt the gush. Ladies, you know what I'm talking about. So 
I ran to the bathroom and discovered the mess. I was crying and went to go 
tell my mom, but she was in an awful mood, so I tried teaching myself how 
to use a tampon by myself! That was mistake #1.  Mistake #2 was grabbing an 
ultra sized one, followed by mistake #3 which was popping it out of the 
plastic applicator and forcefully shoving it inside me.  

Girls, just tell a trusted adult when it first happens. Don't do what I 
did. PLEASE.﻿
comments.author: mk irwin

comments.text:
I have to wear toilet paper with my pad or the blood gets everywhere, like 
on the sides...but my mom doesn't like me to use all the toilet paper...but 
I have to...﻿
comments.author: Mari Pellegrino

comments.text: I thought I was the only one too! I'm a bit glad I'm not, actually.
comments.author: Mari Pellegrino

comments.text: +Mari Pellegrino oh my god i thought i was the only one
comments.author: Cypris

comments.text:
One time at school in 5th grade I began to bleed when we where getting 
ready to leave for home. It was very terrifying because you have this huge 
line of kids and I had no tampon on me. SO I stand up which was a terrible 
idea because my butt became soaked in seconds. I use an excuse to run to 
the bathroom but it becomes very scary because you have everyone staring at 
you and you are sweating like crazy. Sweat pours down my forehead and I 
have my hands behind my butt trying to hide it because I had light colored 
pants which where vulnerable to red stains. I escaped the horror without 
nobody noticing, thank goodness I had an extra jacket to hide my butt!
I usually wear dark/black jeans most of the time just in case this happens 
again and I assure you IT WILL HAPPEN!!!﻿
comments.author: Aileene Sanchez

comments.text:
I had to have a hysterectomy at 29 due to extreme excessive bleeding. Blood 
spilled from me like I was pissing myself, but with blood. After 2 hospital 
stays and 2 blood transfusions I was excited to never bleed again. Then, 2 
weeks after the surgery I'm back in the hospital bleeding from my vagina, 
some weak artery was responsible, I never even needed a hysterectomy. Do I 
win? ﻿
comments.author: M Lehman

comments.text:
The first story was so cute though!!

Anyway, my embarrassing period story is about this one time i was on my 
period, right? and i went to this concert and it was like 5 hours long, 
standing room only, and i like, squatted down to crack my knees and blood 
just flowed out of me like Angel Falls and i went to the bathroom, which 
was full of drunk girls smoking weed, and i find out that i leaked through 
not only my pad, but my underwear, AND jeans!!﻿
comments.author: Audrey Maire

comments.text:
I got period on my vacation once. we had to borrow a car and my period just 
came out of nowhere. It bled through my pants and into the seats. I was 
dying of emberassment﻿
comments.author: Mimi Do

comments.text:
when i first got my period i woke up and i went to the bathroom to find out 
that i got my period but then i fainted (>~<)﻿
comments.author: lily bvb

comments.text:
I went to a beach once not long after I got my very first period. I was 
still inexperienced with dealing with it so I guess I put the pad on wrong 
or something. All I know is that I was wearing a pad when I got into the 
water and that pad had vanished by the time I got out. I completely forgot 
I was even on my period while I swam. In the car on the way home, I was 
eating a half melted candy bar that I dropped in my lap. When I wiped the 
melted chocolate from between my legs, my fingers were covered with not 
only chocolate, but blood as well. That seat smelled like blood and 
chocolate for a long time...﻿
comments.author: mysterymoose

comments.text:
My mom tried to comfort me by telling me that I'm so sweet, I bleed 
chocolate.
comments.author: mysterymoose

comments.text:
I was working at the movie theater, selling tickets, and it was monday so I 
was the only one selling tickets. So my period started and I couldn't go to 
the bathroom because... there were nobody else to sell tickets. So I called 
the manager over .... but it took him like 1 hour to come.... I was all 
dirty and so embarassed. And he wanted me to explain why I disturbed him 
haha..... ALL I WANTED TO DO IS TO YELL AT HIM WHY IT TOOK 1 HOUR TO COME 
WHEN HIS OFFICE IS LIKE AT 2 MINUTES FROM WHERE I AM >:l﻿
comments.author: Catherine Verret (Why Lion)

comments.text:
It's not that I'm ashamed of my period or people seeing my pads or tampons 
but it's the way people react that annoys me ﻿
comments.author: Kara McGrath

comments.text:
Am I lucky that I barely have a period at all? I mean, I've only ever 
gotten bad period pain once but that was many years ago. Plus, my period 
only lasts like..3 days and it's never heavy. ._.﻿
comments.author: Andrea Stephens

comments.text:
I hate putting in tampons. They feel uncomfortable and it scares me that it 
will get stuck. My mom told me about her friend who went to a waterpark 
during her period and how it got stuck after being pushed up going down a 
slide. Her husband had to help her with it. That just freaks me out and I 
avoid them if I can.﻿
comments.author: Sabrina grimm (sistersgrimmfan)

comments.text:
I was in the middle of my English class working on classwork when my period 
started with no warning. One second everything was good and then it was 
like a volcano has erupted. Luckily we could leave for the bathroom when 
our teacher was not teaching so I grabbed a pad and some undies I kept in 
my bag and went to change. I was happy that it had not leaked on my pants 
and that my pants were black so if it did it could be hidden.﻿
comments.author: Sabrina grimm (sistersgrimmfan)

comments.text:
I got mine during running tests or whatever
Realised at half of the morning
Got home 3 hours later
3 HOURS OF HELL RUNNING WITH PERIOD﻿
comments.author: RAZ0RSHARP

comments.text:
My worst story would be from my junior year in high school. My period came 
a week early. I have no fucking idea when it started in that hour's time, 
but when I got up from my seat in computer science, I noticed a lovely red 
stain (I am so lucky they weren't cloth chairs. So. Lucky.) about the size 
of my hand on the chair. It was my last class of the day, so I just went 
home and hid under my blanket for a few hours. I didn't. Fucking. Clean. 
The goddamn. Blood up.﻿
comments.author: mintycookie129

comments.text:
For all the young girls reading and commenting about being scared or 
nervous about starting there period.. Some women have very very light 
periods. Which can even last 1-2 days with only light spotting. Which most 
girls do for there first periods so no need to be worried about starting 
and having blood like everywhere! Your body will work up too that. (But one 
can always hope you will be the lucky one with light periods in your life!) 
:) ﻿
comments.author: Ashley Nicole

comments.text:
One time I had to stay late after school to work on a group project and I 
bled so much, blood was literally seeping out and I remember seeing a trail 
of blood run down my thigh but I had a jacket tied around my waist do I 
thought no one would notice. Someone probably did. Good it was horrible. ﻿
comments.author: EmbracetheAmity

comments.text:
My grandmother had period until her womb was removed when she was 60. I've 
inherited a lot of traits from her and I'm seriously hoping I won't have to 
deal with that shit to my retirement. At least my mother's stopped at a 
reasonable age.

As for period stories... I was in upper secondary school on history class, 
and just figured I was hungry and needed to go to the bathroom after class, 
but lo and behold that combination of feelings was my period kicking in. 
And when I got up after the end of the class, there was a nasty red puddle 
on the chair. I tried to discreetly clean the mess while others left the 
room.﻿
comments.author: TearsofaLunarian

comments.text:
Lml I had the same thing happen last week I pulled out two I was so shocked 
﻿
comments.author: Maia99

comments.text: I'm 17 and I'm still having shit like that happening... That's sad.﻿
comments.author: Autumn Ouellette
